p: On the other hand, chlorogenic acid (CHA) is a caffeoylquinic acid constituent ( Fig. 3C) found in many vegetables and fruits traditionally used in Turkish folk medicine, such as Cydonia oblonga, Crataegus monogyna, Morus alba, Hypericum perforatum, Eucalyptus globules ( Baytop, 1999; Ding et al., 2017; Kim and Chung, 2018). Indeed, many researchers including Ding et al. (2017) and Ren et al. (2019) have pointed out that CHA acts as a neuraminidase blocker to inhibit influenza A virus at both in vitro and in vivo levels, thus they stated that CHA is potentially beneficial in the treatment of influenza.
